alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN, NORTHERN FAIRFIELD AND NORTHEASTERN PICKAWAY COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 500 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Ashville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Reynoldsburg, Pickerington, Canal Winchester, Ashville, Baltimore, Millersport, Pleasantville, Fairfield Beach, Royalton, Lithopolis, Thurston, Carroll, Fairfield County Airport, East Ringgold, Slate Run Metro Park, State Route 158 at State Route 204, Dumontville and State Route 674 at State Route 188. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
